docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.budgets
docs.text:
Required:

  • amount (Number) (Required) The total amount of cost to track with the budget.
  • notifications (Attributes List) (Required) One or more notification objects. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • time_grain (String) (Optional) The time covered by a budget. Tracking of the amount will be reset based on the time grain. Must be one of BillingAnnual, BillingMonth, BillingQuarter, Annually, Monthly and Quarterly. Defaults to Monthly. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.budgets.notifications
docs.text:
Required:

  • contact_emails (List of String) (Required) Specifies a list of email addresses to send the budget notification to when the threshold is exceeded.
  • threshold (Number) (Required) Threshold value associated with a notification. Notification is sent when the cost exceeded the threshold. It is always percent and has to be between 0 and 1000.

Optional:

  • operator (String) (Optional) The comparison operator for the notification. Must be one of EqualTo, GreaterThan, or GreaterThanOrEqualTo. Defaults to EqualTo.
  • threshold_type (String) (Optional) The type of threshold for the notification. This determines whether the notification is triggered by forecasted costs or actual costs. The allowed values are Actual and Forecasted. Default is Actual. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.keyvault
docs.text:
Optional:

  • purge_protection_enabled (Boolean) (Optional) Is Purge Protection enabled for this Key Vault? Defaults to true.
  • sku (String) (Optional) The Name of the SKU used for this Key Vault. Possible values are standard and premium. Defaults to standard.
  • soft_delete_retention_days (Number) (Optional) The number of days that items should be retained for once soft-deleted. This field can only be configured one time and cannot be updated. This value can be between 7 and 90 days. Defaults to 90.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.resource_groups_lock
docs.text:
Optional:

  • baseline (Boolean) (Optional) Boolean flag to enable/disable RG lock. Defaults to true.
  • rsv (Boolean) (Optional) Boolean flag to enable/disable RG lock. Defaults to false.

docs.title: Import
docs.text:
Import is supported using the following syntax:

$ terraform import volocloud_tenancy_account_azure.example <resource ID>

Note

The format is: "account_id:tenancy_id:tenancy_account_id"

docs.title: volocloud_tenancy_account_module_azure_vdi (Resource)
docs.text: Tenancy Account Module Azure VDI resource configuration main schema.

docs.title: Required
docs.text:
• configuration (Attributes) (Required) Provides configuration required to setup Azure Virtual Desktop VDI solution. (see below for nested schema)
  • name (String) (Required) Name of the Azure Virtual Desktop environment.
  • volo_tenancy_account_id (String) (Required) Volocloud Tenancy Account ID.
  • volo_tenancy_id (String) (Required) Volocloud Tenancy ID.

docs.title: Read-Only
docs.text:
• id (String) (Computed) ID of the resource computed from the account_id, tenancy_id, tenancy_account_id and tenancy_account_module_azure_vdi_id separated by : .
  • last_updated (String) (Computed) Timestamp when create/update have ran.
  • volo_account_id (String) (Computed) Volocloud Account ID associated with this tenancy_account.
  • volo_tenancy_account_module_azure_vdi_id (String) (Computed) Volocloud Tenancy Account Module Azure VDI ID.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration
docs.text:
Optional:

  • personal (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration for an AVD Personal Host Pool. Conflicts with pooled type. (see below for nested schema)
  • pooled (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration for an AVD Personal Host Pool. Conflicts with personal type. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.personal
docs.text:
Required:

  • abbreviation (String) (Required) This abbreviation will be used to uniquily identify Session Host VMs created by this resource and joined in the same AD.
  • deployment_template (String) (Required) Provides the deployment template for the host pool, based on which AVD resources are created. Can be one: marketplace or statistical_computing. Defaults to marketplace.
  • number_of_session_hosts (Number) (Required) How many Session Host VMs should be deployed in the host pool.

Optional:

  • operating_system (String) (Optional) Windows version to use for the Session Host VMs. Can be one of: windows_10 or windows_11.Defaults to windows_11.
  • password_rotation_days (Number) (Optional) Privides the Session Host VMs local admin password rotation in days. Can be a number between 0 and 365 days. If 0 is provided, the password never rotates. Defaults to 90 days.
  • sku (String) (Optional) Provide the Session Host VMs SKU to be used for the Host Pool. Can be one of: Standard_D2ads_v5, Standard_D4ads_v5, Standard_E2ads_v5 or Standard_E4ads_v5. Defaults to Standard_D2ads_v5.
  • tags (Map of String) (Optional) Key-value map of resource tags for all the host pool resources.

Read-Only:

  • ad_join_type (String) (Optional) Provide the AD that will be used to join the Session Host VMs. Can be one of: microsoft_entra_domain_services or microsoft_entra_id. Defaults to microsoft_entra_domain_services.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.pooled
docs.text:
Required:

  • abbreviation (String) (Required) This abbreviation will be used to uniquily identify Session Host VMs created by this resource and joined in the same AD.
  • deployment_template (String) (Required) Provides the deployment template for the host pool, based on which AVD resources are created. Can be one: marketplace or statistical_computing. Defaults to marketplace.
  • number_of_session_hosts (Number) (Required) How many Session Host VMs should be deployed in the host pool.

Optional:

  • operating_system (String) (Optional) Windows version to use for the Session Host VMs. Can be one of: windows_10_multi or windows_11_multi.Defaults to windows_11_multi.
  • password_rotation_days (Number) (Optional) Privides the Session Host VMs local admin password rotation in days. Can be a number between 0 and 365 days. If 0 is provided, the password never rotates. Defaults to 90 days.
  • sku (String) (Optional) Provide the Session Host VMs SKU to be used for the Host Pool. Can be one of: Standard_D2ads_v5, Standard_D4ads_v5, Standard_E2ads_v5 or Standard_E4ads_v5. Defaults to Standard_D2ads_v5.
  • tags (Map of String) (Optional) Key-value map of resource tags for all the host pool resources.

Read-Only:

  • ad_join_type (String) (Optional) Provide the AD that will be used to join the Session Host VMs. Can be one of: microsoft_entra_domain_services or microsoft_entra_id. Defaults to microsoft_entra_domain_services.

docs.title: volocloud_tenancy_aws
docs.text: Volocloud Tenancy configuration. The AWS Cloudformation template obtained from volocloud_account resource MUST be deployed before this resource is created.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
# Create AWS Tenancy
# Deploy new AWS Organizations and AWS Identity Center.
# Deploy new AWS Accounts for network and shared-services accounts.
resource "volocloud_tenancy_aws" "example" {
  account_id = volocloud_account.example.account_id
  configuration = {
    abbreviation = "expl"
    accounts = {
      audit = {
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = true
          }
        }
        securityhub = {
          enabled = true
          notifications = {
            subscribers = [
              {
                emails = ["example+securityhub@example.com"]
              }
            ]
          }
          standards = {
            aws_foundational_security_best_practices = {
              controls = {
                "iam.6" = {
                  disable_control = true
                  disable_reason  = "We have virtual MFA and don't plan to have hardware MFA."
                }
              }
              enabled = true
              version = "v1.0.0"
            }
            cis_aws_foundations_benchmark = {
              controls = {
                "1.6" = {
                  disable_control = true
                  disable_reason  = "We have virtual MFA and don't plan to have hardware MFA."
                }
              }
              enabled = true
              version = "v1.4.0"
            }
          }
        }
      }
      log_archive = {
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = true
          }
        }
      }
      management = {
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = false
          }
        }
      }
      network = {
        aws_account_close_on_delete = false
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = true
          }
        }
        dns_resolver = {
          enabled = true
          forwarding_domains = [
            {
              dns_domain = "example.test"
              dns_servers = [
                "1.2.3.4",
                "5.6.7.8",
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
        dns_zones = {
          private_subdomains = {
            dev  = "dev"
            prod = "prod"
            qa   = "qa"
            test = "test"
          }
          public_domains = [
            "test.example.com",
          ]
        }
        network_firewall = {
          enabled = true
        }
        transit_gateway = {
          enabled = true
        }
      }
      shared_services = {
        aws_account_close_on_delete = false
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = true
          }
        }
      }
    }
    assume_role = {
      account_id  = "123456789012"
      arn         = volocloud_account.example.resources.aws.management_accounts["123456789012"].bootstrap_role_arn
      external_id = volocloud_account.example.resources.aws.management_accounts["123456789012"].bootstrap_role_external_id
    }
    dns_domain   = "example.com"
    email        = "example@example.com"
    environments = ["dev"]
    organization = {
      backup = {
        enabled = true
      }
      controltower = {
        access_management = true
      }
    }
    regions = {
      home = {
        primary = {
          location = "ap-southeast-2"
          network = {
            enabled = true
            ip_schema = {
              address = "172.16.0.0"
              environments = {
                core = {
                  address = "172.16.0.0"
                  mask    = 18
                }
                dev = {
                  address = "172.16.192.0"
                  mask    = 18
                }
              }
              mask = 16
            }
          }
          region = "apse2"
        }
      }
    }
    tags = {
      key1 = "value1"
    }
  }
  name = "example"
}

# Create AWS Tenancy
# Reuse existing AWS Organizations and AWS Identity Center.
# Reuse existing AWS Accounts for network and shared-services accounts.
resource "volocloud_tenancy_aws" "example" {
  account_id = volocloud_account.example.account_id
  configuration = {
    abbreviation = "expl"
    accounts = {
      audit = {
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = true
          }
        }
        securityhub = {
          enabled = true
          notifications = {
            subscribers = [
              {
                emails = ["example+securityhub@example.com"]
              }
            ]
          }
          standards = {
            aws_foundational_security_best_practices = {
              controls = {
                "iam.6" = {
                  disable_control = true
                  disable_reason  = "We have virtual MFA and don't plan to have hardware MFA."
                }
              }
              enabled = true
              version = "v1.0.0"
            }
            cis_aws_foundations_benchmark = {
              controls = {
                "1.6" = {
                  disable_control = true
                  disable_reason  = "We have virtual MFA and don't plan to have hardware MFA."
                }
              }
              enabled = true
              version = "v1.4.0"
            }
          }
        }
      }
      log_archive = {
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = true
          }
        }
      }
      management = {
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = false
          }
        }
      }
      network = {
        aws_account_close_on_delete = false
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = true
          }
        }
        dns_resolver = {
          enabled = true
          forwarding_domains = [
            {
              dns_domain = "example.test"
              dns_servers = [
                "1.2.3.4",
                "5.6.7.8",
              ]
            }
          ]
        }
        dns_zones = {
          private_subdomains = {
            dev  = "dev"
            prod = "prod"
            qa   = "qa"
            test = "test"
          }
          public_domains = [
            "volocloud.test",
          ]
        }
        network_firewall = {
          enabled = true
        }
        transit_gateway = {
          enabled = true
        }
      }
      shared_services = {
        aws_account_close_on_delete = false
        backup = {
          restore_testing = {
            enabled = true
          }
        }
      }
    }
    assume_role = {
      account_id  = "123456789012"
      arn         = volocloud_account.example.resources.aws.management_accounts["123456789012"].bootstrap_role_arn
      external_id = volocloud_account.example.resources.aws.management_accounts["123456789012"].bootstrap_role_external_id
    }
    dns_domain   = "example.com"
    email        = "example@example.com"
    environments = ["dev"]
    organization = {
      backup = {
        enabled = true
      }
      controltower = {
        access_management = false
        central_logging = {
          reuse_existing = {
            account_id = "123456789012"
            enabled    = true
          }
        }
        # org_units = {}
        security = {
          reuse_existing = {
            account_id = "123456789012"
            enabled    = true
          }
        }
      }
      reuse_existing = {
        identity_store_id = "d-id"
        organization_id   = "o-id"
      }
    }
    regions = {
      home = {
        primary = {
          location = "ap-southeast-2"
          network = {
            enabled = true
            ip_schema = {
              address = "172.16.0.0"
              environments = {
                core = {
                  address = "172.16.0.0"
                  mask    = 18
                }
                dev = {
                  address = "172.16.192.0"
                  mask    = 18
                }
              }
              mask = 16
            }
          }
          region = "apse2"
        }
      }
    }
    tags = {
      key1 = "value1"
    }
  }
  name = "example"
}

docs.title: Required
docs.text:
• account_id (String) (Required) Volocloud Account ID associated with this account.
  • configuration (Attributes) (Required) Provides configuration required to setup the Tenancy. (see below for nested schema)
  • name (String) (Required) Volocloud tenancy Name.

docs.title: Optional
docs.text:
• credentials (Attributes) (Optional) Provides credentials required to setup the Tenancy. (see below for nested schema)
  • trigger_update (String) (Optional) This attribute provides a mechanism to trigger an update on the tenancy resouce when there is no change to the other attributes.

docs.title: Read-Only
docs.text:
• id (String) (Computed) ID of the resource computed from the account_id and tenancy_id separated by : .
  • resources (Map of String) These are all the resources created in the tenancy.
  • tenancy_id (String) (Computed) Volocloud Tenancy ID.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration
docs.text:
Required:

  • abbreviation (String) (Required) This abbreviation will be used to uniquily identify resources created. Only applies to resources that require AWS global uniqueness.
  • accounts (Attributes) (Required) Configuration details for AWS Accounts part of tenancy. (see below for nested schema)
  • assume_role (Attributes) (Required) AWS Management Account details for Volocloud bootstrap role to be assumed. (see below for nested schema)
  • dns_domain (String) (Required) DNS domain to be used as the root DNS for the AWS tenancy. private dns subdomains will be created based on this.
  • email (String) (Required) Email address for the root user of the provisioned AWS Accounts part of this tenancy. Must support subaddressing (+ sign) and be max 42 chars.
  • organization (Attributes) (Required) AWS services configuration applicable at AWS Organization level. (see below for nested schema)
  • regions (Attributes) (Required) Defines which regions to deploy into. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • environments (List of String) (Optional) List of environments to be deployed part of the tenancy. Can be one of: dev, prod, qa and test. Defaults to [dev, prod, test]
  • idp (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration details for AWS Identity Centre SSO. (see below for nested schema)
  • tags (Map of String) (Optional) Key-value map of resource tags for all the tenancy resources.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts
docs.text:
Required:

  • audit (Attributes) (Required) Provides details for configuring audit resources. (see below for nested schema)
  • log_archive (Attributes) (Required) Provides details for configuring log archive resources. (see below for nested schema)
  • management (Attributes) (Required) Provides details for configuring management resources. (see below for nested schema)
  • network (Attributes) (Required) Provides details for configuring network resources. (see below for nested schema)
  • shared_services (Attributes) (Required) Provides details for configuring shared services resources. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit
docs.text:
Required:

  • backup (Attributes) (Required) AWS Backup configuration settings for the local account. (see below for nested schema)
  • securityhub (Attributes) (Required) Manages the Security Hub Configuration for AWS Organization. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • alternate_contacts (Attributes Map) (Optional) Configuration of AWS Account alternate contacts. (see below for nested schema)
  • ebs_encryption_by_default (Boolean) (Optional) Whether or not default EBS encryption is enabled. Defaults to true.
  • guardduty (Attributes) (Optional) Provides a resource to manage Amazon GuardDuty for this AWS Organization. (see below for nested schema)
  • inspector (Attributes) (Optional) Provides a resource to managed AWS Inspector for this AWS Organization. (see below for nested schema)
  • primary_contact (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration of AWS Account primary contact. (see below for nested schema)
  • s3_account_public_access_block (Attributes) (Optional) Manages S3 account-level Public Access Block configuration. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block
docs.text:
Required:

  • restore_testing (Attributes) (Required) If enabled, it will create a restore testing plan with multiple resource type selections. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • vault_lock (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration settings for the AWS Organization Backup Vault lock. (see below for nested schema)
  • vault_notifications (Attributes List) Configuration settings for the AWS Organization Backup Vault notifications. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block.restore_testing
docs.text:
Required:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Required) If true, enables the AWS Backup restore testing plan for supported resources.

Optional:

  • protected_resource_selection_tags (Attributes List) (Optional) A list of conditions that you define for resources in your restore testing plan using tags. Filters the values of your tagged resources for only those resources that you tagged with the same value. (see below for nested schema)
  • protected_resource_selection_types (List of String) (Optional) The type of AWS resource included in a restore testing selection.
  • recovery_point_selection (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration of recovery points for AWS Backup restore testing plan. (see below for nested schema)
  • schedule_expression (String) (Optional) A cron expression in UTC specifying when AWS Backup initiates a restore test. For more information about AWS cron expressions, see Cron expressions reference for Rules in the Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide. If not specified, the policy will have a default start time at 1 AM on the 15th of every month.
  • schedule_expression_timezone (String) (Optional) This is the timezone in which the schedule expression is set. By default, schedule_expression is in UTC. You can modify this to a specified timezone.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block.restore_testing.schedule_expression_timezone
docs.text:
Optional:

  • tag_key (String)
  • tag_value (String)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block.restore_testing.schedule_expression_timezone
docs.text:
Optional:

  • algorithm (String) (Optional) Acceptable values include LATEST_WITHIN_WINDOW or RANDOM_WITHIN_WINDOW.
  • recovery_point_types (List of String) (Optional) Acceptable values include CONTINUOUS and SNAPSHOT.
  • selection_window_days (Number) (Optional) Accepted values are integers from 1 to 365.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block.vault_lock
docs.text:
Optional:

  • changeable_for_days (Number) (Optional) The number of days before the lock date. If omitted creates a vault lock in governance mode, otherwise it will create a vault lock in compliance mode.
  • max_retention_days (Number) (Optional) The maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. Defaults to 90. !> Changing this value causes the Backup Vault to be re-created.
  • min_retention_days (Number) (Optional) The minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. Defaults to 1. !> Changing this value causes the Backup Vault to be re-created.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block.vault_notifications
docs.text:
Required:

  • recipients (Attributes) (Required) The recipients of the specified Backup Vault events. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • events (List of String) (Optional) An array of events that indicate the status of jobs to back up resources to the backup vault.
  • filter_policy (String) (Optional) JSON String with the filter policy that will be used in the SNS subscription to filter messages seen by the target resource. Refer to the SNS docs for more details.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block.vault_notifications.filter_policy
docs.text:

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block
docs.text:
Required:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Required) Enables Security Hub for this AWS Organization and the core AWS Accounts.

Optional:

  • notifications (Attributes) (Optional) Settings for configuring email based notifications for SecurityHub using SNS. (see below for nested schema)
  • products (Attributes List) (Optional) Enables the integration of a partner product with Security Hub in Audit AWS Account. Integrated products send/receive findings to/from Security Hub. (see below for nested schema)
  • standards (Attributes) (Optional) Manages Security Hub Standards and their controls for this AWS Organization. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block.notifications
docs.text:
Required:

  • subscribers (Attributes List) (Required) A list of notification objects for receiving SecurityHub alerts. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • findings_pattern (String) (Computed) SecurityHub event rule findings pattern to configure which events are sent to the SNS topic, formatted as JSON string. The SecurityHub event rule and findings format can be found in AWS documentation: [Configuring an EventBridge rule for automatically sent findings]https://docs.aws.amazon.com/securityhub/latest/userguide/securityhub-cwe-all-findings.html. Only one findings pattern can be configured for all events generated by SecurityHub. Defaults to all new and active findings.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block.notifications.findings_pattern
docs.text:
Required:

  • emails (List of String) (Required) Specifies a list of email addresses to send the budget notification to when the threshold is exceeded.

Optional:

  • filter_policy (String) (Optional) JSON String with the filter policy that will be used in the SNS subscription to filter messages seen by the target resource. Refer to the SNS docs for more details. If not provided, all messages received by the SNS Topic will be forwarded to subscribers.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block
docs.text:
Optional:

  • auto_enable_organization_members (Boolean) (Optional) Indicates the auto-enablement configuration of GuardDuty for the member accounts in the organization. Defaults to true.
  • detector_features (List of String) (Optional) Provides a resource to manage Amazon GuardDuty organization configuration features. Can be one of: ebs_malware_protection, eks_audit_logs, eks_runtime_monitoring, eks_runtime_monitoring_addon_management, lambda_network_logs, rds_login_events, s3_data_events. The eks_runtime_monitoring_addon_management is used only if eks_runtime_monitoring is present as well.
  • enabled (Boolean) (Optional) Enables Guardduty for this AWS Organization.
  • finding_publishing_frequency (String) (Optional) Specifies the frequency of notifications sent for subsequent finding occurrences.Valid values: FIFTEEN_MINUTES, ONE_HOUR, SIX_HOURS.
  • threatiplist (List of String) (Optional) Provides a resource to manage a GuardDuty ThreatIntelSet.
  • trustiplist (List of String) (Optional) Provides a resource to manage a GuardDuty IPSet.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.audit.s3_account_public_access_block
docs.text:
Required:

  • address_line_1 (String) (Required) The first line of the primary contact address.
  • city (String) (Required) The city of the primary contact address.
  • country_code (String) (Required) The ISO-3166 two-letter country code for the primary contact address.
  • full_name (String) (Required) The full name of the primary contact address.
  • phone_number (String) (Required) The phone number of the primary contact information. The number will be validated and, in some countries, checked for activation.
  • postal_code (String) (Required) The postal code of the primary contact address.

Optional:

  • address_line_2 (String) (Optional) The second line of the primary contact address, if any.
  • address_line_3 (String) (Optional) The third line of the primary contact address, if any.
  • company_name (String) (Optional) The name of the company associated with the primary contact information, if any.
  • district_or_county (String) (Optional) The district or county of the primary contact address, if any.
  • state_or_region (String) (Optional) The state or region of the primary contact address. This field is required in selected countries.
  • website_url (String) (Optional) The URL of the website associated with the primary contact information, if any.

  • ignore_public_acls (Boolean) (Optional) Whether Amazon S3 should ignore public ACLs for buckets in this account. Defaults to true.
  • restrict_public_buckets (Boolean) (Optional) Whether Amazon S3 should restrict public bucket policies for buckets in this account. Defaults to true.

docs.text:
Required:

  • schedule_expression (String) (Optional) A cron expression in UTC specifying when AWS Backup initiates a restore test. For more information about AWS cron expressions, see Cron expressions reference for Rules in the Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide. If not specified, the policy will have a default start time at 1 AM on the 15th of every month.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.management.s3_account_public_access_block.vault_lock
docs.text:
Optional:

  • max_retention_days (Number) (Optional) The maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. Defaults to 90. !> Changing this value causes the Backup Vault to be re-created.
  • min_retention_days (Number) (Optional) The minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. Defaults to 1. !> Changing this value causes the Backup Vault to be re-created.

  • s3_account_public_access_block (Attributes) (Optional) Manages S3 account-level Public Access Block configuration. (see below for nested schema)
  • transit_gateway (Attributes) (Optional) Hub and Spoke architecture. Conflicts with cloud_wan. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.network.transit_gateway
docs.text:
Required:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Required) If true, deploys a Hub and Spoke architecture based on AWS Transit Gateway.

Optional:

  • aws_side_asn (Number) (Optional) Private Autonomous System Number (ASN) for the Amazon side of a BGP session. The range is 64512 to 65534 for 16-bit ASNs and 4200000000 to 4294967294 for 32-bit ASNs. Extra AWS Regions will increment by 1. Defaults to 65000.
  • vpc (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration for the VPC deployed in the Hub. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.network.transit_gateway.vpc
docs.text:
Optional:

  • enable_dns_hostnames (Boolean) (Optional) A boolean flag to enable/disable DNS hostnames in the VPC. Defaults to true.
  • enable_dns_support (Boolean) (Optional) A boolean flag to enable/disable DNS support in the VPC. Defaults to true.
  • instance_tenancy (String) (Optional) A tenancy option for instances launched into the VPC. Default is default, which ensures that EC2 instances launched in this VPC use the EC2 instance tenancy attribute specified when the EC2 instance is launched. The only other option is dedicated, which ensures that EC2 instances launched in this VPC are run on dedicated tenancy instances regardless of the tenancy attribute specified at launch.
  • ipam (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration for VPC IPAM service deployed in the Hub. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.accounts.network.transit_gateway.vpc.ipam
docs.text:
Optional:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Optional) Is VPC IPAM enabled? Defaults to true.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.assume_role
docs.text:
Required:

  • account_id (String) (Required) The AWS Management Account ID where Volo bootstrap Role was created from the AWS CloudFormation Template provided by the volocloud provider account resource.
  • arn (String) (Required) The Volo bootstrap Role ARN created from the AWS CloudFormation Template provided by the volocloud provider account resource.
  • external_id (String) (Required) The Volo AWS External ID created by the volocloud provider account resource.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization
docs.text:
Required:

  • backup (Attributes) (Required) AWS Backup configuration settings for the AWS Organization. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • controltower (Attributes) (Optional) Settings for Controltower Landing Zone. (see below for nested schema)
  • password_policy (Attributes) (Optional) Manages Password Policy for the AWS Account. (see below for nested schema)
  • policy_types (List of String) (Optional) The policy type that you want to enable. You can specify one of the following values: AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY, BACKUP_POLICY, TAG_POLICY. The SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY is enabled by AWS Control Tower and cannot be disabled by this resource. Defaults to BACKUP_POLICY.
  • reuse_existing (Attributes) (Optional) Reuse existing AWS Organizations and AWS Identity Center enabled in the provided management account. The AWS Organization must have ALL enabled features and the AWS Identity Center MUST be integrated with the organization. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.backup
docs.text:
Required:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Required) If true, will create Backup Vault in the Shared Services account that will be used for a centralized copy of each local backup vault.

Optional:

  • policies (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration settings for built-in backup policies. (see below for nested schema)
  • report_plan_templates (List of String) (Optional) Backup Report Plan Templates.
  • vault_lock (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration settings for the AWS Organization Backup Vault lock. (see below for nested schema)
  • vault_notifications (Attributes List) Configuration settings for the AWS Organization Backup Vault notifications. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.backup.vault_notifications
docs.text:
Optional:

  • daily (Attributes) (Optional) Built-in daily backup policy. (see below for nested schema)
  • monthly (Attributes) (Optional) Built-in monthly backup policy. (see below for nested schema)
  • weekly (Attributes) (Optional) Built-in weekly backup policy. (see below for nested schema)
  • yearly (Attributes) (Optional) Built-in yearly backup policy. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.backup.vault_notifications.daily
docs.text:
Optional:

  • backup_complete_window_minutes (Number) (Optional) A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before it must be completed or it will be canceled by AWS Backup. Defaults to 1 day.
  • backup_start_window_minutes (Number) (Optional) A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start successfully. If this value is included, it must be at least 60 minutes to avoid errors. Defaults to 60 minutes.
  • copy_to_region (String) (Optional) Creates a copy action in the backup plan that will copy the backup to the organization backup vault specified by region. The specified region MUST have been defined in the regions attribute.
  • delete_after_days (Number) (Optional) Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be 90 days greater than move_to_cold_storage_after_days.
  • move_to_cold_storage_after_days (Number) (Optional) Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.
  • opt_in_to_archive_for_supported_resources (Boolean) (Optional) This setting will instruct your backup plan to transition supported resources to archive (cold) storage tier in accordance with your lifecycle settings.
  • schedule_expression (String) (Optional) A cron expression in UTC specifying when AWS Backup initiates a backup job. For more information about AWS cron expressions, see Cron expressions reference for Rules in the Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide. If not specified, the policy will have a default start time at 11 PM every day.
  • schedule_expression_timezone (String) (Optional) This is the timezone in which the schedule expression is set. By default, schedule_expression is in UTC. You can modify this to a specified timezone.
  • selection_tag (String) (Optional) Specifies the tag key name to search for on resources to add to the backup plan. The value of this tag MUST be true.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.backup.vault_notifications.monthly
docs.text:
Optional:

  • backup_complete_window_minutes (Number) (Optional) A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before it must be completed or it will be canceled by AWS Backup. Defaults to 1 day.
  • backup_start_window_minutes (Number) (Optional) A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start successfully. If this value is included, it must be at least 60 minutes to avoid errors. Defaults to 60 minutes.
  • copy_to_region (String) (Optional) Creates a copy action in the backup plan that will copy the backup to the organization backup vault specified by region. The specified region MUST have been defined in the regions attribute.
  • delete_after_days (Number) (Optional) Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be 90 days greater than move_to_cold_storage_after_days.
  • move_to_cold_storage_after_days (Number) (Optional) Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.
  • opt_in_to_archive_for_supported_resources (Boolean) (Optional) This setting will instruct your backup plan to transition supported resources to archive (cold) storage tier in accordance with your lifecycle settings.
  • schedule_expression (String) (Optional) A cron expression in UTC specifying when AWS Backup initiates a backup job. For more information about AWS cron expressions, see Cron expressions reference for Rules in the Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide. If not specified, the policy will have a default start time at 2 AM every first day of month.
  • schedule_expression_timezone (String) (Optional) This is the timezone in which the schedule expression is set. By default, schedule_expression is in UTC. You can modify this to a specified timezone.
  • selection_tag (String) (Optional) Specifies the tag key name to search for on resources to add to the backup plan. The value of this tag MUST be true.

If not specified, the policy will have a default start time at 12 AM every Sunday.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.backup.vault_notifications
docs.text:
Optional:

  • changeable_for_days (Number) (Optional) The number of days before the lock date. If omitted creates a vault lock in governance mode, otherwise it will create a vault lock in compliance mode.
  • max_retention_days (Number) (Optional) The maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. Defaults to 90.
  • min_retention_days (Number) (Optional) The minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. Defaults to 1.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.backup.vault_notifications
docs.text:
Required:

  • recipients (Attributes) (Required) The recipients of the specified Backup Vault events. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • events (List of String) (Optional) An array of events that indicate the status of jobs to back up resources to the backup vault.
  • filter_policy (String) (Optional) JSON String with the filter policy that will be used in the SNS subscription to filter messages seen by the target resource. Refer to the SNS docs for more details.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.backup.vault_notifications.recipients
docs.text:
Optional:

  • email (List of String) (Optional) List of email addresses.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.controltower
docs.text:
Optional:

  • access_management (Boolean) (Optional) If enabled, AWS Control Tower will create a new AWS Identity Center instance integrated with the AWS Organization and will create/manage SSO roles and permion sets. It MUST be true if there is no AWS Organization/AWS Identity Center to reuse. It SHOULD be false if AWS Organizations/AWS Identity Center are reused or after tenancy has been created and either sso attribute is defined or you want to use the tenancy managed identity center groups. Defaults to true.
  • central_logging (Attributes) (Optional) Settings for S3 bucket(s) used for central logging. (see below for nested schema)
  • landing_zone_version (String) (Optional) AWS ControlTower Landing Zone version. Defaults to 3.3
  • org_units (Attributes) (Optional) Customize the names of the Organization Units that Control Tower creates. (see below for nested schema)
  • security (Attributes) (Optional) Settings for security. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.controltower.security
docs.text:
Optional:

  • retention_days (Map of Number) (Optional) Configures retention in days for provided S3 bucket.
  • reuse_existing (Attributes) (Optional) Reuse AWS Account for Log Archive. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.controltower.security.reuse_existing
docs.text:
Required:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Required) If enabled, it reuses an existing AWS Account for Log Archive.

Optional:

  • account_id (String) (Optional) AWS Account ID to use for Log Archive. MUST be provided if enabled = true.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.controltower.security
docs.text:
Optional:

  • sandbox (String) (Optional) The custom name to use for Sandbox OU. This is only available at CREATE stage and cannot be changed after as the AWS Control Tower APIs doesn't support this update. If not provided, it will create an OU called Sandboxes.
  • security (String) (Optional) The custom name to use for Security OU. This is only available at CREATE stage and cannot be changed after as the AWS Control Tower APIs doesn't support this update. If not provided, it will create an OU called Security.
  • tenancy (Attributes Map) (Optional) Defines custom AWS Control Tower Organization Units to create under the tenancy root managed by this Landing Zone. It supports 2 nested levels under tenancy root. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.controltower.security.tenancy
docs.text:
Required:

  • name (String) (Required) The name of the new OU to create.

Optional:

  • child_ous (Attributes Map) (Optinal) Child OUs to create under this OU. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.controltower.security.tenancy.child_ous
docs.text:
Required:

  • name (String) (Required) The name of the new OU to create.

Optional:

  • child_ous (Attributes Map) (Optinal) Child OUs to create under this OU. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.controltower.security.tenancy.child_ous.child_ous
docs.text:
Required:

  • name (String) (Required) The name of the new OU to create.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.controltower.security
docs.text:
Optional:

  • reuse_existing (Attributes) (Optional) Reuse AWS Account for Audit. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.controltower.security.reuse_existing
docs.text:
Required:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Required) If enabled, it reuses an existing AWS Account for Audit.

Optional:

  • account_id (String) (Optional) AWS Account ID to use for Audit. MUST be provided if enabled = true.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.password_policy
docs.text:
Optional:

  • allow_users_to_change_password (Boolean) (Optional) Whether to allow users to change their own password. Defaults to true.
  • hard_expiry (Boolean) (Optional) Whether users are prevented from setting a new password after their password has expired (i.e., require administrator reset). Defaults to false.
  • max_password_age (Number) (Optional) The number of days that an user password is valid. Defaults to 90.
  • minimum_password_length (Number) (Optional) Minimum length to require for user passwords. Defaults to 14.
  • password_reuse_prevention (Number) (Optional) The number of previous passwords that users are prevented from reusing. Defaults to 24.
  • require_lowercase_characters (Boolean) (Optional) Whether to require lowercase characters for user passwords.. Defaults to true.
  • require_numbers (Boolean) (Optional) Whether to require numbers for user passwords. Defaults to true.
  • require_symbols (Boolean) (Optional) Whether to require symbols for user passwords. Defaults to true.
  • require_uppercase_characters (Boolean) (Optional) Whether to require uppercase characters for user passwords. Defaults to true.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.organization.reuse_existing
docs.text:
Required:

  • identity_store_id (String) (Required) AWS Identity Center Identity Store ID deployed in the provided AWS management account.
  • organization_id (String) (Required) AWS Organizations Organization ID deployed in the provided AWS management account.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions
docs.text:
Required:

  • home (Attributes) (Required) Home geography containing a pair of primary/secondary regions. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • other (Attributes List) (Optional) A list of Non-Home geographies containing a pair of primary/secondary regions in each geography. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home
docs.text:
Required:

  • primary (Attributes) (Required) Primary Aws Region details. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • secondary (Attributes) (Optional) Secondary Aws Region details. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home.secondary
docs.text:
Required:

  • location (String) (Required) The Aws location of the region. Must be one of the Aws supported locations.
  • network (Attributes) (Required) This information is used to deploy a network on top of the landing zone. A lot of other services depend on this. (see below for nested schema)
  • region (String) (Required) The Aws region code of the location. Must be one of the region codes associated with Aws supported locations.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home.secondary.network
docs.text:
Required:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Required) If enabled, it will deploy a network on top of the landing zone.

Optional:

  • ip_schema (Attributes) (Optional) (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home.secondary.network.ip_schema
docs.text:
Optional:

  • address (String) (Optional) The base IP Network for the entire region (e.g. x.x.x.x). It will be used to perform IPAM for the tenancy and it's tenancy accounts. CANNOT be changed after creation without destroying everything running on top of the network. Defaults to 172.16.0.0.
  • environments (Attributes) (Optional) The Network CIDR configuration for environments. (see below for nested schema)
  • mask (Number) (Optional) The base IP Network Mask for the entire region (e.g. 16). It will be used to perform IPAM for the tenancy and it's tenancy accounts. It MUST be between 8 and 18. CANNOT be changed after creation without destroying everything running on top of the network. Defaults to 16

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home.secondary.network.ip_schema.mask
docs.text:
Optional:

  • core (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)
  • dev (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)
  • prod (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)
  • qa (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)
  • test (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home.secondary.network.ip_schema.mask.test
docs.text:
Optional:

  • mask (Number) (Optional) The base IP Network Mask for the environment. It MUST be between 10 and 20. CANNOT be changed after creation without destroying everything running on top of the network.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.other.secondary.network.ip_schema.mask.test

Optional:

  • address (String) (Optional) The base IP Network for the environment. CANNOT be changed after creation without destroying everything running on top of the network.
  • mask (Number) (Optional) The base IP Network Mask for the environment. It MUST be between 10 and 20. CANNOT be changed after creation without destroying everything running on top of the network.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.idp
docs.text:
Optional:

  • external (Attributes) (Optional) IdP details for AWS Identity Centre SSO. (see below for nested schema)
  • internal (Attributes) (Optional) Configuration for AWS Identity Center to act as IdP. (see below for nested schema)
  • sp (Attributes) (Optional) AWS Identity Centre SSO Service Provider details to configure with provided external IdP. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.idp.external
docs.text:
Optional:

  • microsoft_entra_id (Attributes) (Optional) Details required to setup Microsoft Entra ID as IdP. Includes creating AWS Single-Sign-On Enterprise Application, SSO and SCIM setup, groups per AWS account and association with AWS Identity Center permission sets. The client id required appropriate permissions. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.idp.external.microsoft_entra_id
docs.text:
Optional:

  • notification_email_addresses (List of String) (Optional) Provides a list of emails to receive notifications from the service principal associated with the AWS Single-Sign-On Enterprise Application.
  • owners (List of String) (Optional) Provides a list of Microsoft Entra ID UPNs that would be configured as owners of the AWS Single-Sign-On Enterprise Application.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.idp.internal
docs.text:
Required:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Required) If enabled, configures AWS Identity Center to act as IdP for AWS Organizations.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.idp.sp
docs.text:
Required:

  • acs_url (String) (Required) AWS Identity Centre Assertion Consumer Service URL.
  • login_url (String) (Required) AWS Identity Centre Access Portal Login URL.
  • scim_endpoint (String) (Required) AWS Identity Centre SCIM Endpoint.
  • sp_url (String) (Required) AWS Identity Centre Service Provider URL.

docs.title: Nested Schema for credentials
docs.text:
Optional:

  • idp (Attributes) (Optional) Service Principal client ID configured in the target Azure tenant. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for credentials.idp
docs.text:
Optional:

  • external (Attributes) (Optional) External IdP credentials to configure with AWS Identity Centre SSO. (see below for nested schema)
  • sp (Attributes) (Optional) AWS Identity Centre SSO Service Provider credentials to configure with provided external IdP. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for credentials.idp.external
docs.text:
Optional:

  • microsoft_entra_id (Attributes) (Optional) Credentials required to setup Microsoft Entra ID as IdP. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for credentials.idp.external.microsoft_entra_id
docs.text:
Required:

  • client_id (String, Sensitive) (Required) Service Principal client ID configured in the target Microsoft Entra ID tenant.
  • client_secret (String, Sensitive) (Required) Service Principal client secret configured in the target Microsoft Entra ID tenant.
  • tenant_id (String, Sensitive) (Required) Target Microsoft Entra ID tenant ID.

docs.title: Nested Schema for credentials.idp.sp
docs.text:
Required:

  • scim_token (String, Sensitive) (Required) AWS Identity Centre SCIM Token.

docs.title: Import
docs.text:
Import is supported using the following syntax:

$ terraform import volocloud_tenancy_aws.example <resource ID>

Note

The format is: "account_id:tenancy_id"

docs.title: volocloud_tenancy_azure
docs.text: Tenancy resource configuration main schema.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
# Example using Azure Existing Billing account of type MPA
resource "volocloud_tenancy_azure" "example" {
  account_id = volocloud_account.example.account_id
  configuration = {
    abbreviation = "expl"
    assume_identity = {
      tenant_id = "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
    }
    billing = {
      account_type = "mpa"
      existing = {
        connectivity_subscription_id = "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
        identity_subscription_id     = "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
        management_subscription_id   = "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
      }
    }
    budgets = {
      root = [
        {
          amount = 1000
          notifications = [
            {
              contact_emails = [
                "example@example.com",
              ]
              threshold = 90
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    }
    dns_domain = "example.com"
    regions = {
      home = {
        primary = {
          location = "australiaeast"
          network = {
            enabled = true
          }
          region = "auee"
        }
      }
    }
    subscriptions = {
      connectivity = {
        abbreviation = "conn"
        azure_bastion = {
          enabled = false
        }
        budgets = [
          {
            amount = 1500
            notifications = [
              {
                contact_emails = [
                  "example@example.com",
                ]
                threshold = 90
              }
            ]
          }
        ]
        ddos_protection_plan = {
          enabled = false
        }
        dns_resolver = {
          inbound = {
            enabled = false
          }
          outbound = {
            enabled = true
            forwarding_domains = [
              {
                dns_domain = "example.com"
                dns_servers = [
                  "1.2.3.4",
                  "5.6.7.8",
                ]
              }
            ]
          }
        }
        dns_zones = {
          private_subdomains = {
            dev  = "dev"
            prod = "prod"
            qa   = "qa"
            test = "test"
          }
          public_domains = [
            "test.example.com",
          ]
        }
        hub_networks = {
          azure_firewall = {
            enabled = true
          }
          enabled = true
          virtual_network_gateway = {
            enabled = true
            s2s_vpns = [
              {
                gateway_address = "1.2.3.4"
                gateway_address_space = [
                  "10.10.0.0/16",
                ]
                gateway_name = "test"
              }
            ]
            type     = "Vpn"
            vpn_type = "RouteBased"
          }
        }
        keyvault = {
          soft_delete_retention_days = 7
        }
      }
      identity = {
        abbreviation = "id"
        azuread_domain_services = {
          admin_vm = {
            admin_username                       = "local.admin"
            computer_name                        = "aaddsadmin"
            enabled                              = true
            shutdown_schedule_notification_email = "example@example.com"
            shutdown_schedule_recurrence_time    = "0000"
          }
          enabled = true
          notification_recipients = [
            "example@example.com",
          ]
          sku = "Standard"
        }
        budgets = [
          {
            amount = 500
            notifications = [
              {
                contact_emails = [
                  "example@example.com",
                ]
                threshold = 90
              }
            ]
          }
        ]
        keyvault = {
          soft_delete_retention_days = 7
        }
      }
      management = {
        abbreviation = "mgmt"
        automation_account = {
          sku = "Basic"
        }
        budgets = [
          {
            amount = 500
            notifications = [
              {
                contact_emails = [
                  "example@example.com",
                ]
                threshold = 90
              }
            ]
          }
        ]
        keyvault = {
          soft_delete_retention_days = 7
        }
        mdfc = {
          email = "example@example.com"
        }
        vnet = {
          subnets = {
            paas = {
              agw = {
                enabled = true
                service_endpoints = [
                  "Microsoft.KeyVault",
                ]
              }
            }
            standard = {
              secured = {
                delegation = {
                  actions = [
                    "Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/subnets/join/action",
                  ]
                  name    = "psqlfs"
                  service = "Microsoft.DBforPostgreSQL/flexibleServers"

                }
                service_endpoints = [
                  "Microsoft.KeyVault",
                  "Microsoft.Storage",
                ]
              }
            }
          }
          vnet_link_to_private_dns_zones = [
            "privatelink.postgres.database.azure.com",
          ]
        }
      }
    }
    tags = {}
  }
  credentials = {
    client_id       = "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
    client_secret   = "client_secret"
    subscription_id = "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
    tenant_id       = "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
  }
  name = "example"
}

docs.title: Required
docs.text:
• account_id (String) (Required) Volocloud Account ID associated with this account.
  • configuration (Attributes) (Required) Provides configuration required to setup the Tenancy. (see below for nested schema)
  • credentials (Attributes) (Required) Provides credentials required to setup the Tenancy. (see below for nested schema)
  • name (String) (Required) Volocloud tenancy Name.

docs.title: Optional
docs.text: • trigger_update (String) (Optional) This attribute provides a mechanism to trigger an update on the tenancy resouce when there is no change to the other attributes.

docs.title: Read-Only
docs.text:
• id (String) (Computed) ID of the resource computed from the account_id and tenancy_id separated by : .
  • resources (Map of String) These are all the resources created in the tenancy.
  • tenancy_id (String) (Computed) Volocloud Tenancy ID.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration
docs.text:
Required:

  • abbreviation (String) (Required) This abbreviation will be used to uniquily identify resources created. Only applies to resources that require Azure global uniqueness and to Management Groups.
  • assume_identity (Attributes) (Required) Azure Tenant details for Volocloud bootstrap identity to be assumed. (see below for nested schema)
  • billing (Attributes) (Required) Provides the details required for Microsoft Azure billing. Must provide only one of ea, existing, mca, mpa attributes. (see below for nested schema)
  • dns_domain (String) (Required) DNS domain associated with this tenancy.
  • regions (Attributes) (Required) Defines which regions to deploy into. (see below for nested schema)
  • subscriptions (Attributes) (Required) Azure Core Subscriptions: connectivity, identity and management configuration. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • budgets (Attributes) (Optional) Provides a nested List of nested budget object to associate with a Management Group. (see below for nested schema)
  • environments (List of String) (Optional) List of environments to be deployed part of the tenancy. Can be one of: dev, prod, qa and test. Defaults to [dev, prod, test]
  • tags (Map of String) (Optional) Key-value map of resource tags for all the tenancy resources.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.assume_identity
docs.text:
Required:

  • tenant_id (String) (Required) The Azure Tenant ID where Volo bootstrap identity was created from the Azure ARM Template provided by the volocloud provider account resource.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.billing
docs.text:
Required:

  • account_type (String) (Required) Microsoft Azure Billing Account type. Must be one of ea, mca, mpa.

Optional:

  • ea (Attributes) (Optional) Provides required billing information to create subscriptions for a Microsoft Enterprise Agreement billing account. Conflicts with existing, mca, mpa. (see below for nested schema)
  • existing (Attributes) (Optional) Provides existing tenancy core subscription ids. Conflicts with ea, mca, mpa. (see below for nested schema)
  • mca (Attributes) (Optional) Provides required billing information to create subscriptions for an Microsoft Customer Agreement billing account. Conflicts with existing, ea, mpa. (see below for nested schema)
  • mpa (Attributes) (Optional) All the CSP Partners that we support to create subscriptions programatically. Conflicts with ea, existing, mca attributes. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.billing.ea
docs.text:
Required:

  • account_id (String) (Required) Microsoft Enterprise Agreement billing account id.
  • enrollment_id (String) (Required) Microsoft Enterprise Agreement billing enrollment id.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.billing.existing
docs.text:
Required:

  • connectivity_subscription_id (String) (Required) Existing subscription id to be used for connectivity.
  • identity_subscription_id (String) (Required) Existing subscription id to be used for identity.
  • management_subscription_id (String) (Required) Existing subscription id to be used for management.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.billing.mca
docs.text:
Required:

  • account_id (String) (Required) Microsoft Customer Agreement billing account id.
  • invoice_id (String) (Required) Microsoft Customer Agreement billing invoice id.
  • profile_id (String) (Required) Microsoft Customer Agreement billing profile id.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.billing.mpa
docs.text:
Optional:

  • rhipe (Attributes) (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.billing.mpa.rhipe
docs.text:
Optional:

  • description (String) (Optional) Rhipe Description.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions
docs.text:
Required:

  • home (Attributes) (Required) Home geography containing a pair of primary/secondary regions. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • other (Attributes List) (Optional) A list of Non-Home geographies containing a pair of primary/secondary regions in each geography. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home
docs.text:
Required:

  • primary (Attributes) (Required) Primary Aws Region details. (see below for nested schema)

Optional:

  • secondary (Attributes) (Optional) Secondary Aws Region details. (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home.secondary
docs.text:
Required:

  • location (String) (Required) The Azure location of the region. Must be one of the Azure supported locations.
  • network (Attributes) (Required) This information is used to deploy a network on top of the landing zone. A lot of other services depend on this. (see below for nested schema)
  • region (String) (Required) The Azure region code of the location. Must be one of the region codes associated with Azure supported locations.

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home.secondary.network
docs.text:
Required:

  • enabled (Boolean) (Required) If enabled, it will deploy a network on top of the landing zone.

Optional:

  • ip_schema (Attributes) (Optional) (see below for nested schema)

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home.secondary.network.ip_schema
docs.text:
Optional:

  • address (String) (Optional) The base IP Network for the entire region (e.g. x.x.x.x). It will be used to perform IPAM for the tenancy and it's tenancy accounts. CANNOT be changed after creation without destroying everything running on top of the network. Defaults to 172.16.0.0.
  • environments (Attributes) (Optional) The Network CIDR configuration for environments. (see below for nested schema)
  • mask (Number) (Optional) The base IP Network Mask for the entire region (e.g. 16). It will be used to perform IPAM for the tenancy and it's tenancy accounts. It MUST be between 8 and 18. CANNOT be changed after creation without destroying everything running on top of the network. Defaults to 16

docs.title: Nested Schema for configuration.regions.home.secondary.network.ip_schema.mask
docs.text:
Optional:

  • core (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)
  • dev (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)
  • prod (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)
  • qa (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)
  • test (Attributes) (Optional) The IP CIDR for environment. (see below for nested schema)

  • mask (Number) (Optional) The base IP Network Mask for the environment. It MUST be between 10 and 20. CANNOT be changed after creation without destroying everything running on top of the network.

  • mask (Number) (Optional) The base IP Network Mask for the entire region (e.g. 16). It will be used to perform IPAM for the tenancy and it's tenancy accounts. It MUST be between 8 and 18. CANNOT be changed after creation without destroying everything running on top of the network. Defaults to 16
